alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Northwest Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 1:10PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 200 PM MST... At 110 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Pleasant, or 9 miles west of New River, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New River, Cave Creek, Lake Pleasant, Camp Creek, Anthem and Seven Springs. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 223 and 240. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 18 and 30. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 130 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Northwest Valley
